data.title: AN OPEN LETTER TO LOCAL 802 AFM RE: ALLEGATIONS OF SEXUAL MISCONDUCT BY NY PHILHARMONIC MUSICIANS
data.meta_description: We, a diverse community of composers, musicians, educators, leaders, and allies, call for the investigation of New York Philharmonic musicians Matthew Muckey and Liang Wang by Local 802 AFM to be immediately re-opened.
data.text:
AN OPEN LETTER TO LOCAL 802 AFM REGARDING ALLEGATIONS OF SEXUAL MISCONDUCT BY NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC MUSICIANS MATTHEW MUCKEY AND LIANG WANG

Composers Collective

·

Follow

63 min read

·

Apr 15, 2024

--

If you would like to add your name to this letter, please submit your name via this form. The list of signatories will be updated every few hours.

Note from the editor, 4/16/24 9:00amEST: there are a few blank entries in the submission form; if you believe that you signed as of 9am EST but don’t see your name, please feel free to resubmit!

April 15, 2024

In response to Sammy Sussman’s article, “A Hidden Sexual-Assault Scandal at the New York Philharmonic” in Vulture on 12 April 2024 (https://www.vulture.com/article/new-york-philharmonic-sexual-assault-scandal.html), we, a diverse community of composers, musicians, educators, leaders, and allies, call for the investigation of New York Philharmonic musicians Matthew Muckey and Liang Wang by Local 802 AFM to be immediately re-opened. We also call for both Muckey and Wang to be put on immediate suspension from the New York Philharmonic.

By allowing the alleged perpetrators to remain in their positions, musicians and survivors face a daily affront, with the potential for further harassment, discrimination, and abuse. If no action is taken, institutions seemingly endorse illegal, unethical, and bigoted behavior.

Sincerely,

Laura Karpman, composer

Nora Kroll-Rosenbaum, composer

Kristin Kuster, Composer, U-Mich Ann Arbor

Paola Prestini, composer and cofounder National Sawdust

Sarah Kirkland Snider, composer and Co-Artistic Director, New Amsterdam Records
